com.arctro

Class DatabaseObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.arctro.DatabaseObject

  • public abstract class DatabaseObject
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract class designed for mapping database values to an object
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ben McLean

      • DatabaseObject

        public DatabaseObject(java.sql.Connection conn,
                      int id,
                      ColumnGroup columns)
               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Constructor selects and maps values from a row
        Parameters:
        conn - A database connection
        id - The id of the row to select
        columns - The columns to select
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown when an SQL error occurs

    • Method Detail

      • generateSelect

        protected java.lang.String generateSelect(ColumnGroup columns)
        Generates a select statement. Do not allow user inputed columns, as column tables or names are not sanitized and result in a huge security hole when improperly handled.
        Parameters:
        columns - The columns to select
        Returns:
        A select statement

      • mapValues

        protected abstract void mapValues(java.sql.ResultSet rs,
                                  ColumnGroup columns)
        Maps values from a result set to the data HashMap.
        It is suggested that the function be written similarly to this: 
        
        if(columns.isAll()){
                <Set Data>
                return;
        }
 
        Column[] c = columns.getColumns();
        int s = c.length;
 
        for(int i = 0; i<s; i++;){
                switch(c.getColumn()){
                case("<Example>"){
                        data.set("<Example>", <Get Variable>);
                        break;
                }
                etc...
                }
        }
        Parameters:
        rs - The result set to get values from
        columns - The columns that have been selected

      • get

        public java.lang.Object get(java.lang.String key)
        Gets a value. It is recommended that this generic function is replaced with a getter for every possible variable, for robustness and ease of use.
        A typical function would look similar to this:
        
        public String getUsername(){
                return (String) data.get("username");
        }
        Parameters:
        key - The key to get
        Returns:
        A value

      • put

        public void put(java.lang.String key,
                java.lang.Object value)
        Sets a value. It is recommended that this generic function is replaced with a setter for every possible variable, for robustness and ease of use.
        A typical function would look similar to this:
        
        public void setUsername(String value){
                data.set("username", value);
        }
        Parameters:
        key - The key to set
        value - The value to set

      • set

        public boolean set(java.lang.String key)
        Returns if a key/value is null or not
        Parameters:
        key - The key to check
        Returns:
        If a key/value is null or not
